channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ID
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ID

item.title: Report E-2023090197
item.description:
Report E-2023090197

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: MERIDIAN
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one 50 pound paper bag of chlorothanonil technical (un2588) had been torn by a sharp object and had released 200 grams of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023080960
item.description:
Report E-2023080960

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: POCATELLO
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPI experienced a UN1760 Gengard GN8142 release from a 30-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released impacting a 4’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. Spill-X and Floor Dry were deployed to neutralize and clean the impacted area. The damaged drum and impacted absorbents were then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023081891
item.description:
Report X-2023081891

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: BOISE
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: AM QA discovered package leaking in unload. Employee put on proper PPE. Package was contained and placed in a lined hazmat bin. Bin was then placed in Hazmat cage under the air vent. DescribePack: There were 4 plastic bottles of degreaser in which 2 of them were loose and some of the content spilled on the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Employee put on proper PPE. Package was contained and placed in a lined hazmat bin. Bin was then placed in Hazmat cage under the air vent.
